section.title: Batch Processes Deliver batch processes batch processes
section.para:
Admin
> Batch Processes
> Batch/Scheduled Jobs

The following table summarizes the functions of the system’s Deliver batch processes. These processes generate notices of various kinds, generate bills for lost items, delete temporary circulation histories and update reshelved materials’ item status.

Each job may be scheduled by a library to run at any time. From the Admin menu, click Batch/Scheduled Jobs to enter the lookup. Click Search. Click Edit to change the schedule for any job. (As of now, the jobs are set to run at 2 AM Eastern time. A more user-friendly scheduling method will be developed.)

Output files from these jobs are stored at a location chosen by the library. The location is identified as the system parameter PDF_Location which can be found at Admin > System Configuration > Parameter.

entry.para: Identifies overdue items and creates notices for delivery to patrons using their preferred delivery method. A first overdue notice is generated n days/hours after the due date/time; subsequent overdue notices (how many determined locally by the "numberOfOverdueToBeSent" parameter defined in local circulation policies) are then generated n days/hours after the last notice. Also generates replacement fee bills for items that have received n overdue notices.

A library may opt to send patrons reminder notices when borrowed items are close to their due dates/times. This job creates these notices for delivery to patrons using their preferred delivery method but only for patrons whose records have the courtesy notice flag turned on.
If a library decides to store temporary circulation histories, this job purges those records systematically. (OLE runs this job at 2am every morning but this is locally configurable.)

If a library cannot fulfill the request, this notice informs the patron that the request has expired. The notice is sent out n number of days. N is assigned by the Request expiration Days field on each circulation desk but can be overridden when the request is created. Alternatively if the library chooses NOT to establish a default expiration for requests on the Circulation Desk maintenance document, it may choose to set the requestExpirationDay in the Circ Policy
Identifies requested items that have been on hold but are now beyond the expiration date and removes the request within OLE.

note.para: Do not run this job before the generateRequestExpirationNoticeJob. If you do, the request is deleted from the request table before the request expiration notice has been sent to the patron.

entry.para: Creates on-hold notices for delivery to patrons using their preferred delivery method to inform them when a requested item has become available and at what pick-up location.
If PDFs are generated for mail delivery, the PDF_LOCATION stores the directory location.

Circulation Desks may set an interval to allow for the time lag between check-in and reshelving. When this interval is defined, items checked-in are given the item status “Recently returned”. This job, following the interval, changes the item status to “Available”.

note.para: See additional information about the shelving lag time in the Circulation Desk documentation.

entry.para: A library may opt to send patrons notices when requested items have been removed from an on-hold status because the patrons never picked up the items. This job creates these notices for delivery to patrons using their preferred delivery method but only for patrons whose records have the courtesy notice flag turned on.

section.title: Circulation
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Circulation Links
On the Deliver menu, Circulation provides access to a number of circulation functions that allow users to view and maintain a variety of standard Circulation E-Docs.

section.title: Loan
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Loan
> Loan
A loan consists of identifying a patron and then creating temporary links to the item(s) being loaned to the patron. The Loan interface allows for staff to circulate materials to patrons.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: OLE breaks down circulation permissions into several roles. Unit Manager have all loan privileges including override permissions. Operator have only “create loan” permissions.

note.para: You will receive errors if not logged in as a user mapped to a circulation desk. Login before selecting Loan from the Deliver Menu.

section.para: Each staff operator can be authorized to work at one or more circulation desks; one must be set as the default. If they have more than one circulation desk, they will be able to change from one circulation desk to another to indicate where they are. When an operator changes a circulation desk during a session, the change will persist for the rest of the session. The next time the operator logs in, OLE will return them to their default location.

note.para: For more information about Circulation Desk maintenance and mapping, see Circulation Desk and Circulation Desk Mapping.

mediaobject.alt: Circulation Desk Field near the Login/Logout buttons

listitem.para:
Once you have opened the Loan interface, type or scan the Patron Barcode and press Enter. Alternatively, you may search for the patron from the lookup
. If you search for a patron record from the lookup, the resulting display will show a Return Value link to the left of each patron. Click on that link to populate the patron field on the Loan screen. Press Enter.

note.para: The preferred addresses on a patron’s record must be verified otherwise the warning “Patron’s street address has not been verified” will appear.

tip.para: Clicking on the Return button will take you to the return screen, allowing you to check-in materials.

listitem.para: Once the patron barcode is entered, details about the patron will appear above the Patron field. If there is a block on the patron or some other problem, then an error message will appear. You may need to access the patron record to address the error or, in some cases an override is permitted for you to continue.

note.para: For more information about Patron Documents, see Patron.

listitem.para: If text exists in a user note field in the patron record, this message displays immediately whenever the patron’s barcode is scanned into the system. (The purpose is to be able to deliver a message to the patron in person.) The operator has the option to acknowledge and delete the message or simply acknowledge -- in the latter case, the message remains and continues to display each time the patron barcode is entered until the text is removed.

Type or scan the Item Barcode, or search for it from the lookup
.
Press Enter

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Sample Patron with one item checked out

listitem.para: OLE will calculate the due date and time and update the item status to "Loaned". This information displays in the Items Checked Out This Session section of the screen. A sound will notify staff of successful check-outs or alert them of issues to address (provided the sound parameter AUDIO_OPTION is turned on and your computer has speakers).

When loaning an item to a patron, an alert may appear to inform you of any problems based on local configurations settings. OLE provides a pop up screen to assist staff to correct these errors and/or override them so that the loan can proceed.

If the patron has presented more than one item to borrow, type or scan the next item barcode and press Enter. Each new item checked-out will appear at the top of the Items Checked Out This Session list.

To view all items a patron has checked out, click the Show All Items Currently Checked Out
button.

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: All Items Currently Checked Out Tab

listitem.para: If there are any pending requests, a View all requests link will appear in the far right column.
Clear the patron information to prepare for the next patron.

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Click Clear Patron, second button from the left.

tip.para: Each Circulation Location also defines a timeout interval which has the same effect as manually ending a session. This can be locally configured.

section.title: Fast Adds
section.para: If an item does not have a barcode or cannot be found by a search, click Fast-Add item to create a brief record. This will open a simple record editor on top of the Loan window:

listitem.para: You must enter all fields that have asterisks (*) before their labels, these are required.
Click Submit.

OLE will provide you with an error message if you forget to enter a value for required field. If the system accepts the data, the window closes and supplies the item barcode in the Item field of the Loan screen.
Press Enter on your keyboard.

section.para: The Loan now proceeds.

section.title: Options available from the Loan Screen
section.para: You will notice that there are a row of buttons available at the top of the Loan Screen. These are explained below

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Buttons available from the Loan screen after a Patron has been entered.

section.title: Close and Clear Patron
section.para:
If you change circulation desks for a loan and then want to switch back to your default location, click Close
. You will not exit the Loan screen but default settings will be restored.

If you need to clear a patron to loan items to a new patron, click Clear Patron
.

section.title: Renew and Modify Due Dates/Times
section.para: From the top of the loan screen, you can renew items or modify due dates/times.

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Click Alter Due Date, third button from the left.

listitem.para: To renew, select line items from the Current Session Item list or the Items Currently Checked Out list. You can also click the Select All button for either or both lists.

Click Renew
.
OLE will update due dates/times.

tip.para: Alternatively, enter the item barcode in the item field as though loaning the item and press Enter. The item will be renewed for the patron.

listitem.para: To modify or alter a due date/time, select line items from the Current Session Item list or the Items Currently Checked Out list. You can also click the "Select All" button for either or both lists.

Click Alter Due Date
.
The Alter Due Date window will appear.

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Alter Due Date Pop-up

listitem.para:
Enter in a new Due Date or use the calendar icon
. Note that you can also adjust the due time if your loan periods are hourly, if you do not specify a time, OLE will assume 23:59:59. This assumed time can be changed from the parameter DEF_CLOSE_TIME.

Click Update
.

section.title: Claims Return
section.para: Patrons sometimes notify library staff that they have returned items for which they may have received overdue notices or replacement fee bills. In such circumstances a library staff operator with proper permission needs to manually turn on a “claims returned” flag in the item and have the system automatically record the date of the event. Marking an item as claimed returned will cancel any outstanding requests and a cancellation notice will be sent to the requestor.

listitem.para: To perform the claims return from the loan screen, select the line item associated with the title.

Click Claims Return
from the top row of buttons available.
Type any notes to record specific circumstances in the pop up window:

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Claim Return Note Pop-up

listitem.para:
Click Save
.
The claims return note and date will appear in the item record and if the item is requested to circulate again.

section.title: Missing Piece
section.para: If the operator observes that the item presented for checkout is missing a piece, then they can report the missing piece within OLE. Missing pieces are noted on the item record and will remind staff with each circulation transaction if the item remains in circulation.

listitem.para: To mark an item as missing a piece from the loan screen, select the line item associated with the title.

Click Missing Piece
from the top row of buttons available.
Type how many pieces are missing from the item and add a notes to record specific circumstances in the pop up window:

Click Save
.
The missing piece count, note, and date will appear in the item record and when the item is requested to circulate again.

section.title: Damaged
section.para: If the operator observes that the item presented for checkout is damaged, then they can report the damage within OLE. Damages are noted on the item record and a notice will pop up with each circulation transaction if the item remains in circulation.

listitem.para: To mark an item as damaged from the loan screen, select the line item associated with the title.

Click Damaged
from the top row of buttons available.
Type a notes to record specific circumstances in the pop up window:

Click Save
.
The note and date will appear in the item record and when the item is requested to circulate again.

Click Remove Damaged Flag
to remove the damage flag.

section.title: Printing Call Slips
section.para: You may print call slips from the item record.
Click the barcode number to access the item record.

mediaobject.alt: Loan screen: Click the barcode link access, to the left of the title, to open the item record

note.para: To learn more about printing call slips, see the section of the item record under the Describe and Manage Module.

listitem.para: Circulation policies are based on three factors: item location, item type and borrower type. Each specific combination determines the loan period, applicable maximum limits, and other policies pertaining to renewals, requests, etc. These can be defined locally.
Staff must log in and select a circulation desk before loaning, or checking-in items.
Item barcodes are required for an item to circulate.

section.title: Request Search
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Request Search
> Request Lookup
** Helpful notes:

listitem.para: At this time the back button simply sends you back to the Deliver homescreen (not back to the last page you were on). It does the same thing as Cancel

If you select the wrong request type, you will receive an error. The system will allow you to select a new request type without having to start over. The same applies with patron, simply delete patron name and barcode and select the magnifying glass lookup to search for another patron.

section.para: The Request Document allows staff operators to place patron requests for library items.
Request types include:

listitem.para: Recall (for hold or delivery) - The ability for a patron to ask that an item currently on loan to another patron be returned.
Hold (for hold or delivery) - The ability for a patron to ask that an item currently on loan to another patron be made available when it is returned.
Page (for hold or delivery) - The ability for a patron to ask that an item not on loan be retrieved and either placed on hold or be delivered.
Copy - The ability for a patron to ask for a photocopy or PDF of a part of an item.
In-Transit - The ability for a patron to ask for an item that is currently in route between circulation desks
ASR - The ability for a patron to ask for an item that is located in the Automated Storage and Retrieval System

section.para: A “for hold” request means that the patron (i.e., the requester) will come to a pick-up location to retrieve the item when available.
A “for delivery” request means that the item will be automatically checked out and delivered to the patron’s preferred street address when it becomes available.

Each patron’s delivery privileges (either “yes” or “no”) are stored in the patron record and the system will automatically select the request method based on this value. However, if a patron’s delivery privileges=yes, the system still provides for selection of a pick-up location. If one is selected, the request is recall/hold, not recall/delivery.

Delivery privileges can be automatically enabled for any patron of a designated borrower type , e.g., you might set up OLE so that any patron belonging to borrower type “faculty” gets delivery privileges. However, delivery privileges can be assigned on an individual basis as well, e.g., you may enable delivery for any student with a physical disability.

Most copy requests are now typically filled by scanning the required item and a file is then emailed to the patron, meaning that copy requests are “delivered” via email. If a paper copy is made, the staff operator will manually address an envelope using the preferred street address from the patron record.
Patrons can place their own requests via a library’s user interface which will need to be customized to interact with the OLE request logic appropriately.

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: To request new items, staff will find Create New to the very right in the Request Lookup.

listitem.para: Click Create New in the upper right side of the interface.

mediaobject.alt: From the Request Lookup, click Create New in the top right corner

listitem.para: The Request window will appear.
Select the User Type from the drop down menu.
Select the Request Type from the drop down.

Enter the Patron Id or search for it from the lookup
. This can also be the Proxy Patron Id.
Asterisks indicate a required field.

Once you have entered the patron information, enter the Item Barcode or search for it from the lookup
.
Different Request Types call for different information. Once selected, the interface will change slightly depending on what you select.
Below is an example of a Recall/Hold Request:

mediaobject.alt: Request Document: Recall/Hold Request Request Details

entry.para: The type of patron making the request. Select the Type from the dropdown list.
Required. The type of request being made. Select the Type from the dropdown list.

The barcode of the patron. Search from the lookup
and OLE will automatically fill all Patron infotmation.
The name of the patron making the request.

Required. The barcode of the item. Search from the lookup
and OLE will automatically fill all Item information.
The title of the requested item. This will be filled automatically when you lookup the item barcode.
The author of the requested item. This will be filled automatically when you lookup the item barcode.
The shelving location of the requested item. This will be filled automatically when you lookup the item barcode.
The call number of the requested item. This will be filled automatically when you lookup the item barcode.
The copy number of the requested item. This will be filled automatically when you lookup the item barcode.

The numeric position of the patron in the patron queue. Once a request is linked to an item, any subsequent borrower requests for the same item are added to the request record and assigned a position in a queue.
Patron Queues can be updated by authorized staff from Request Re-Order
The circulation desk at which the patron will pick up their hold.
The system-generated date at which OLE sent the recall notice.
The date that the patron makes the request. Defaults to today's date but may be edited.

The date that the patron no longer needs the requested item. Enter a date or select it from the calendar icon
.

listitem.para: Copy Requests include fields for format and page information:

mediaobject.alt: Request Document: Copy Request Request Details

para.emphasis: Request Detail Tab Definitions for Copy Requests

entry.para: The format in which the patron would like to receive the copy, such as photocopy or PDF.
The pages or content that the patron would like to have copied.

listitem.para: In-Transit Requests contains a Circulation Location and a Check-in Note field. This is to allow for the situation when an item needs to be sent to another Circulation Location (only library staff may place In-Transit Requests):

mediaobject.alt: Request Document: In Transit Request Request Details

para.emphasis: Request Detail Tab Definitions for In-Transit Requests

entry.para: The circulation desk at which the item should be routed to.
An additional note to be displayed at the time the item is checked-in.

listitem.para:
Click Submit
.

section.title: Modifying or Canceling Requests
section.para: An authorized library staff operator can change a pickup location or an expiration date for a request.

listitem.para:
Enter any search criteria in the Request Lookup screen and click Search
.

note.para: To learn more about searching, see Searching OLE under OLE Basic Functionality.

listitem.para: Click edit to modify the request or cancel to remove the request from OLE.

mediaobject.alt: Request Lookup with Sample Results. Edit, Cancel buttons are on the left

listitem.para: If you click edit, you will be able to change Pickup Location, the Request Expiry Date, and, depending on the request type, the Hold Expiration Date.

When you have made your changes, click Submit
.
Alternatively, if you click cancel from the search screen, a confirmation screen will appear.

Double check that this is the request you would like to cancel and click Cancel
.
The request is canceled and you return to the Deliver Menu.

section.title: Printing Call Slips
section.para: You may print call slips from the item record.
To access the item record, search for an item from the Search Workbench.

note.para: To learn more about Printing Call Slips, see the relevant section of the item record under the Describe and Manage Module.
For more information about the Search Workbench, see Search Workbench under OLE Basic Functionality.

listitem.para: When a request for a patron is completed (i.e., the item is checked out to the patron), the request information is removed from active requests and archived.
Requests can only be placed at the item level. Title-level requests will be a future OLE enhancement.

Not all requests are allowed for any item at any time. E.g., you cannot place a page request for an item currently loaned. In that situation, the operator would place a recall or hold request depending on the requester’s preference.

section.title: Request Re-order
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Request Re-order
> Request Re-order
When more than one patron has requested the same item, an authorized library staff operator can display the request record that enumerates the patrons. The queue can be reordered appropriately.

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: To reorder multiple requests for the same item, locate the Request Re-Order interface under Circulation on the Deliver menu.

listitem.para:
Enter the Item or search for it from the lookup
.

note.para:
You can also re-order requests from the Deliver Item Search's Item Display when your item search only returns one item. Expand the Requests tab and select
.

listitem.para: To reorder the request queue, click and drag the row to the new location. Release your mouse when you see the row in position.

mediaobject.alt: Request Re-order with Sample Requests listed

listitem.para: Click Save.

mediaobject.alt: Request Re-order with Sample Requests listed

listitem.para: When multiple requests are made for the same item, recall requests are always given precedence over other request types. Hold requests have second priority followed by paging and copy requests. If there are multiple requests of the same type from multiple patrons, the system places them in the order in which they were made .

section.title: Return
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Return
> Return

A return session begins with the identification of the item being returned and ends when all the items to be checked in have been processed. Returns utilize item barcode numbers as the primary identifier to begin processing a check-in transaction.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: OLE breaks down circulation permissions into several roles. Unit Manager and operator have permissions to return items within OLE.

note.para: You will receive errors if not logged in as a user mapped to a circulation desk. Login before selecting Loan from the Deliver Menu.

section.para: Each staff operator can be authorized to work at one or more circulation desks; one must be set as the default. If they have more than one circulation desk, they will be able to change from one circulation desk to another to indicate where they are. When an operator changes a circulation desk during a session, the change will persist for the rest of the session. The next time the operator logs in OLE will return them to their default location.

note.para: For more information about Circulation Desk maintenance and mapping, see Circulation Desk and Circulation Desk Mapping.

mediaobject.alt: Circulation Desk Field near the Login/Logout buttons

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: The system automatically assumes today’s date/time as the default date/time of any check-in. An operator can change the date/time as needed (e.g., items returned overnight while the library is closed may be checked-in as if returned yesterday).

tip.para: Clicking on the green Loan button will take you to the Loan menu, allowing you to check-out materials.

section.para: To check-in items, staff will find the Return e-document under Circulation on the Deliver menu.

listitem.para:
Type or scan the item barcode and press Enter. Alternatively, you may search for the item record from the lookup
.
Items returned appear in the Item(s) Returned tab with the most current at the top of the list.

A sound will notify staff of successful check-outs or alert them of issues to address (provided the sound parameter AUDIO_OPTION is turned on the computer has speakers). A visual alert may appear to notify staff of any item related problems based on local configurations settings. These may include recalls, fines, and outstanding holds, item condition notices, and number of pieces an item contains, missing record information, and others. OLE provides a pop up screen to assist staff to correct these errors.
If necessary, OLE will calculate any fines or penalties based upon the locally configured fine rates and create an overdue fine bill and send it automatically to the patron.

note.para: For more information about the Patron Bill, see Patron Bill.

section.title: To mark an item as Claims Return, Item Damaged, or Missing Piece
section.para: If the patron requests a Claim Return, returns the item damaged, or returns the item while missing pieces, you may make note of these situations from the Circulation Information tab of the Item record.
Click on the item barcode to open the Item Record.

note.para: To learn more about the Circulation Information tab of the Item record, see the relevant section.

tip.para: From the item record, you can also print call slips. For more information, see printing call slips under the Describe and Manage Module.

mediaobject.alt: Return screen: Click the barcode link access, to the left of the title, to open the item record

listitem.para: During a check-in transaction, the system compares the due date/time in the loan transaction record to today’s date/time (as set on the Return screen). If today’s date time is AFTER the due date/time, the system verifies if an overdue fine is to be imposed and if so, the rate at which the fine is calculated. The overdue fine bill is then created automatically as part of the return process.

For check-in, if an operator's circulation desk is not the same as the item's “home” location, OLE sets the item status to "in transit" and prints a routing slip so the item can be sent to its “home” location. When the item is checked in again at the “home” circulation desk, the item status returns to “Available” (or “Recently Returned”—an option to allow for the time gap between check-in and reshelving. A batch program changes “Recently Returned” to “Available” once that time gap has expired).
Check-in of a borrowed item increments the item’s circulation counter by “1”. If an item with no loan transaction is checked-in, the system increments the in-house uses counter by”1”.

At check-in, the system also displays notices of special conditions to the operator. E.g., check-in of an item with a pending request shows a message indicating that the item needs to be placed on hold for the requester and an on-hold slip is printed. Other conditions result in other messages/directions for the operator.

section.title: Deliver Item Search
section.para:
Deliver
> Circulation
> Item Search
> Deliver Item Search
The Deliver Item Search allows the operator to search using parameters that are specific to the needs of Circulation staff.
Once you have opened Item Search, you can perform a search to find a record or set of records.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: Each staff operator can be authorized to work at one or more circulation desks; one must be set as the default. If they have more than one circulation desk, they will be able to change from one circulation desk to another to indicate where they are. When an operator changes a circulation desk during a session, the change will persist for the rest of the session. The next time the operator logs in, OLE will return them to their default location.
Since item locations and patron information associated with records displayed in Item Search may pertain to one circulation desk and not another, be sure to login to the desired circulation desk.

note.para: For more information about Circulation Desk maintenance and mapping, see Circulation Desk and Circulation Desk Mapping.

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: When using the Deliver Item Search, depending on your search criteria OLE will display different results.

listitem.para: Searching with Barcode or Item Id:
Once you have opened the Item Search interface, enter the exact Barcode number or Item Id of the item to ensure an exact match.

Press Search
.
Your record will display below the search fields.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search with single record displayed.

listitem.para: From the resulting record, several options are available to you:
The resulting record will contain a clickable Title link to the full bibliographic record.
It will also show a clickable Author link to a prepopulated Search Workbench session for that author.
Click the Additional Copies tab to access the holdings and item records. Clicking on the Details link will open the Item record offering the Place Request option.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search with single record: Additional Copies tab

listitem.para:
Click Place Request
to begin the request process. The Place Request screen will open in a new tab.

mediaobject.alt: Place Request screen accessed from the Deliver Item Search

note.para: For additional information about placing a request through the Deliver Item Search, see Request

listitem.para: Searching with author, title, call number, or publisher
Once you have opened the Item Search interface, enter the desired search team(s) and select as Item Type or Location, if known.

note.para: The Item Type and Location drop down menus' content are dependent on local configuration.

listitem.para:
Press Search
.

In most cases, a list of results will be displayed. The information displayed in the results includes the bibliographic ID, title, author, publication year, holdings location, item location, call number, item status and item type for each result.

For titles with multiple holdings, the Holdings Location display will say “multiple” rather than a location if there is more than one location linked to the title. Also note that the call number and item status displays on this level of the table will be null.

If you need to narrow down your search results, you may enter additional search criteria and click Search
.
Click on the Details link next to the Bib ID to open a second section with a line for each holding record.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search with multiple results

listitem.para: The information displayed includes Holdings ID number, Holdings Location, Call number, Item Location (if there is a single item). Also note that, for multiple items on the same holdings record, the call number and item status displays on this level of the table will be null.

Click on the Details link next to the Holdings ID to display a third section with a line for available items. The information displayed include Item ID, Item Location (if different from Holdings Location), Item Type, Item Barcode (if any), Enum/Chron (if any), Volume (if any), a link to Place Request (see separate section on this topic), and a link to view item requests (if any) or the Place Request button.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search with multiple results: Clicking details displays holdings and item information

listitem.para: Click on the bib ID on the first level to open the Bib record in a new browser tab. The “Edit” message displays to enable editing for staff with appropriate permissions.

note.para: For more information about the OLE MARC Editor, see the section under the Describe and Manage.

listitem.para:
Click on the Holdings ID in the second level to open the Holdings record. Click Edit
to edit the record.

note.para: For more information about editing the Holdings Record, see the section under the Describe and Manage.

listitem.para: Click on the Item ID in the third level to open the Item record. This record is described below.

section.title: Deliver Item Record
section.para: As opposed to the Item Record used by cataloging, the Deliver Item Record offers circulation staff information about the patron and the item circulation history.
Bibliographic information is available in the first section: Title, Author and Publication.
Click the title to open the bibliographic record.

note.para: For more information about the OLE MARC Editor, see the section under the Describe and Manage.

section.para: Click the author to open the Search Workbench search screen with the respective search results from the linked term.

note.para: For more information about the Search Workbench, Search Workbench under OLE Basic Functionality.

section.para: Item and Holdings information is contained in the next section. From the holdings record are Holding Location and Call Number. From the item record are Item Status, Item Status Date, Due Date, Item Location, Item Type, Enumeration/Chronology, Barcode, Number of Pieces, and Call Number if it exists on the item record's field. Most of the information in the Deliver Item Record is pulled from the Holdings and Item records and cannot be edited from this screen.

note.para: For more information about the Holdings and Item Editors, see Instance records under the Describe and Manage Module.

section.para: The rest of the Deliver Item Record are included in the collapsed tabs. Tabs within the Deliver Item Record that contain content display in blue, tabs without content display in grey. They may also display a count, if appropriate. All sections are closed by default.

section.title: Borrower tab
section.para: If the item is checked out to a patron, the Borrower tab will contain Patron Barcode, Patron Type, Patron Name, Patron Expiration Date. If the item was picked up by a proxy borrower, the Borrower tab will contain the Proxy Patron Name and the Proxy Patron Barcode. If item has been renewed, the Borrower tab will contain the Original Charge Date and Original Due Date and Renewal History.

It the item is not checked out to a patron, the Borrower tab will be empty; if the item was not circulated by proxy, the proxy section will not appear; if item has not been renewed, the renewal history table will not appear.

section.title: Additional Copies tab
section.para: The Additional Copies tab shows related bibs and holdings.

section.title: Requests tab
section.para: The Request Tab will display a table with request information: the request type, patron information, the date the request was created and the date it will expire. It also includes the button Place Request that will allow you to place a request on the item and the ReOrder Request button. When either button is clicked, their screens will open in new tabs with the item information prepopulated.

note.para: For information about the Place Request screen, see Request
For information about the Request Re-Order screen, see Request Re-Order

section.title: Item Flags tabs
section.para: The Item Flags shows the Item Flag details already included in the item record in the Item and Holdings records, including notes. Item Flag types are Claims Returned, Damaged, and Missing Pieces.
Check the box to add a flag to the record.

section.title: Note tab
section.para: The Note tab contains public and nonpublic notes that apply to the Item record.

section.title: Outstanding Fines tab
section.para: The Outstanding Fines tab displays a table that shows each outstanding fine or fee associated with this item.

section.title: ID Numbers tab
section.para: The ID Numbers tab displays the Item ID, Holdings ID, Bib ID, OCLC Number, and ISBN.

Clicking on the Item, Holdings, or Bib ID opens the appropriate record in view­only mode in a new browser tab in the search workbench. In all cases, the Edit button is availabe to enable editing for staff with appropriate permissions.

note.para: For more information about the OLE MARC Editor, the Holdings Record, or the Item Record see the sections under the Describe and Manage.

section.para: Clicking on the OCLC number opens a search for that number in the search workbench in a new tab.
Clicking on the ISBN opens a search for that number in the search workbench in a new tab.

note.para: For more information about the Search Workbench, see Search Workbench under OLE Basic Functionality.

section.title: Item History Tab
section.para: The Item History tab displays the item record history and request history. For Item Record, this includes Created Date, Created By, Update Date, and Updated By fields. For Request History, this includes Last Request Type, Final Status, Pick up Location, and Final Status Date.

listitem.para: Circulation policies are based on three factors: item location, item type and borrower type. Each specific combination determines the request-ability of specific items. These can be defined locally.
Staff must log in and select a circulation desk before placing requests.

section.title: Request

note.para: While the "Place Request" from the Deliver Item Search is ideal for working with patrons, for libraries that have a high volume of course reserve recalls to process, the "Create New" request form available from the Request Search page is actually fewer steps.
For information about the Create New link, see Request Search.

section.para: A request is a circulation desk staff operation to recall, place a hold on, page (retrieve) from a collection, or copy pages from a work in the library catalog, either to hold for pickup at a circulation desk, or deliver to the patron’s address.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: Each patron’s paging privileges (either “true” or “false”) are stored in the patron record.

note.para: For more information about patron records, see the patron section in this chapter.

section.para: Paging privileges can be automatically enabled for any patron of a designated borrower type. For example, you might set up OLE so that any patron belonging to borrower type “faculty” gets paging privileges. However, delivery privileges can be assigned on an individual basis as well.

Each patron’s delivery privileges (either “true” or “false”) are stored in the patron record and the system automatically selects the request method based on this value. However, if a patron’s delivery privilege = true, the system still provides for selection of a pick-up location.

Delivery privileges can be automatically enabled for any patron of a designated borrower type, e.g., you might set up OLE so that any patron belonging to borrower type “faculty” gets delivery privileges. However, delivery privileges can be assigned on an individual basis as well. For example, you may enable delivery for any student with a physical disability.

Most copy requests are now filled by scanning the required item and a file is then emailed to the patron, meaning that copy requests are “delivered” via email. If a paper copy is made, the staff operator will manually address an envelope using the preferred street address from the patron record.
Patrons can place their own requests via a library’s interface which will need to be customized to interact with the OLE request logic appropriately.

section.title: Process Overview
section.para: To place a request from the Deliver Item Search, follow these steps.

listitem.para: Click the Item Search link on the Deliver tab.
Search for the item on which you wish to place the request.

note.para: For more information about performing the search, see Deliver Item Search in this chapter.

listitem.para: Select the appropriate Bib ID by clicking Details from the search results. Continue to click Details to open the bibliographic, holding, and finally the Item record details

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search Results: Click Details to view holdings and item records

listitem.para:
Click Place Request
for the appropriate item ID to begin the request process. The Place Request screen will open in a new tab.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search Results: Click Place Request to open the request screen

note.para: If your search only returns one item, the interface will look slightly different. Under the item information, expand the Request tab and click Place Request.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Item Search Results for an individual item: Click Place Request to open the request screen

listitem.para:
In the new tab (or window) enter the Patron Barcode or search for it from the lookup
. Press "Enter"

mediaobject.alt: Place Request screen: Enter the patron barcode

listitem.para:
Additional details about the patron will display. Review the patron information and click Confirm patron and Continue with Request
.

mediaobject.alt: Place Request screen: patron details displayed

listitem.para: Make the following selections:
Request Level

note.para: Title Level requests are still in development for a future release.

listitem.para: Request Type: options based on patron privileges and item availability (for example, recall will only display if the item is checked out, hold will only display if item is checked out or otherwise unavailable on-shelf, page and copy will only display if item is available on-shelf)

note.para: “Copy” and “Page” functionality is still in development for a future release.

listitem.para: Delivery/Pickup details: options based on patron privileges. Delivery is the default if patron is eligible for delivery.
Request Expiration Date: default will display but can be adjusted. The default Request Expiration Date is set on the circulation desk or in the local circulation policy.

note.para: For information about the circulation desk, see Circulation Desk in this chapter.

mediaobject.alt: Place Request screen: select request options available

listitem.para:
Click Submit
.
A confirmation message will display above the Item Information tab indicating the request was successfully created.

mediaobject.alt: Place Request screen: success message displayed above Item Information tab

section.title: Modifying or Canceling Requests
section.para: To modify or cancel a request you must start from the Request Search interface.

note.para: For more information about the modifying or cancelling requests, see the section Modifying or Canceling Requests.

section.title: Patron
section.para: On the Deliver menu, Patron provides access to users to view and maintain standard Patron E-Docs.

section.title: Deliver Notices
section.para: The Deliver Notices allow users to download pdf versions of Recall, On hold, or Overdue notices. The notices will include Patron information and Title/Item information. Pdfs may be printed and sent or emailed to patrons. All notices sent to patrons are sent from an email address that is listed under DELIVER_NOTICE_FROM_ADDRESS unless specified on the circulation desk.
Deliver Notices include:
Hold Notices

listitem.para: Recall Notice - A notice to inform a patron that another user requests an item currently on loan to the patron and their loan time has been shortened. Notices are triggered by the creation of the request. The content of the Recall Notice can be modified by the RECALL_BODY parameter.

On Hold Notice - A notice to inform a patron that an item they had requested is available for pickup. Notices are generated by the generateOnHoldNoticeJob after the item has been checked-in. Notices are generated only for the request types defined by the ON_HOLD_NOTICE_REQUEST_TYPE parameter. The content of the On Hold Notice can be modified by the ONHOLD_BODY parameter.

On Hold Courtesy Notice - A notice to inform a patron that their hold has expired. Notices are generated by the generateHoldCourtesyNoticeJob and are triggered by the On-Hold Days value assigned on each circulation desk. The content of the On Hold Courtesy Notice can be modified by the EXP_HOLD_NOTICE_CONTENT parameter.

Expired Request Notice - A notice to inform a patron that their request has expired without being fulfilled. Notices are generated by the generateRequestExpirationNoticeJob and is triggered by the Request Expiration Days field assigned on each circulation desk but can be overridden when the request is created. Alternatively if the library chooses NOT to establish a default expiration for requests on the Circulation Desk maintenance document, it may choose to set the requestExpirationDay in the Circ Policy. The content of the Expired Request Notice can be modified by the EXP_REQ_BODY parameter.

note.para: For information about Circulation Desks and the Request Expiration Days, see Circulation Desk.

listitem.para: Cancelled Request Notice - A notice to inform a patron that their request has been cancelled. (Manually cancelled by staff.) Notices are generated when the request is cancelled or if a staff member marks the item as claimed returned. The content of the Cancelled Request Notice can be modified by the CANCELLATION_BODY parameter.

section.para: Return Notices

listitem.para: Courtesy Notice - A notice to inform a patron that their library material is about to become due. Notices are generated by the generateCourtesyNoticesJob. The number of days before the due date that the Courtesy Notice is sent out is set by local circulation policies, otherwise the amount of days will be set by the OLE-DLVR COURTESY_NOTICE_INTER parameter. COURTESY_NOTICE_TO_DATE is used to set the scheduled notice date before which courtesy notices will be generated. For example, if the COURTESY_NOTICE_TO_DATE is set to 05/05/2015 (requires mm/dd/yyyy format), any courtesy notices scheduled for 5/4/2015 or before will be generated. The content of the Courtesy Notice can be modified by the COURTESY_NOTICE_CONTENT parameter.

note.para: To configure the jobs for Courtesy Notice, Overdue Notice, and Replacement Bill, NOTICE_THREAD_POOL_SIZE specifies the number of parallel threads to be used in generating notices. This is meant to speed up notice generation.

listitem.para: Missing Pieces Notice – A notice to inform a patron that their recently returned material is missing one or more pieces. Notices are generated upon the return of the item when the staff person indicates a piece(s) is missing. Missing Pieces Notices are not sent to patrons but appear during circulation.

Overdue Notice - A notice to inform a patron that their library material is overdue. Notices are generated by the generateOverdueNoticesJob. After Overdue Notices are sent n times (n is set by the "numberOfOverdueToBeSent" parameter defined in local circulation policies), the generateLostNoticesJob will generate a replacement bill and update the item status as ‘Lost’. OVERDUE_NOTICE_TO_DATE is used to set the scheduled notice date before which overdue notices will be generated. For example, if the OVERDUE_NOTICE_TO_DATE is set to 05/05/2015, any overdue notices scheduled for 5/4/2015 or before will be generated. The content of the Overdue Notice can be modified by the OVERDUE_NOTICE_CONTENT parameter.

Fine Notice – A notice to inform a patron of fines accrued by an overdue item. Notices are generated upon the return of the overdue item. Fine Notices are sent to the patron when generated, alternatively they can be viewed and printed from the Patron Bill screen.

Replacement Bill – A notice to inform a patron that the overdue item is now considered lost. Notices are generated when the item status is updated to ‘Lost’ by the generateLostNoticesJob. LOST_NOTICE_TO_DATE is used to set the scheduled notice date before which replacement bills will be generated. For example, if the LOST_NOTICE_TO_DATE is set to 05/05/2015, any replacement bills scheduled for 5/4/2015 or before will be generated.

note.para: The Scheduled Jobs Technical Documentation includes additional details about the Deliver Notices jobs.

section.para: On the bottom of some of the notice types, Recalls for one, a link to "My Account" will display. This should be modified to your institution's "My Account" patron service. This link location is set by the parameter MY_ACCOUNT_URL. (OLE-DLVR is the Namespace Code).
Deliver Notices can also be accessed from the Admin tab, below the Batch Processes sub menu, under the link Deliver Batch Job.

mediaobject.alt: Deliver Notices Screen with Sample Data

section.title: Patron

note.para: Please click here for technical documentation.

section.para: The Patron document is used to create and maintain the contact information of patrons within OLE.
Tabs within the patron's record that contain content display in blue, tabs without content display in grey.

section.title: Getting Started
section.para: Permissions to create and maintain Patron records are given to several roles. Patron Manager has all privileges to modify Patrons and the maintenance documents. Full Circulation Attendant has permission to edit patron records

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Patron document includes the Overview, Contacts, Affiliations, Library Policies, Loaned Records, Requested Records, Temporary Circulation History Records, Proxy Patron, Proxy For and Local Identification tabs in addition to the standard tabs that display at the bottom of OLE documents.

note.para: For more information about the standard tabs, see Standard Tabs under OLE Basic Functionality.

section.title: Overview Tab
section.para: The Overview Tab of the Patron Document is different from the standard Document Overview tab found on OLE e-documents and contains basic information about the patron record.

entry.para: Required. A unique sequence of numeric or alphanumeric characters printed on a label (also including an optical, machine-readable version of the number) attached to a patron ID card; used to identify the patron in the system for check-out or request transactions; can also serve as a patron login to "my account" functions from the library’s public user interface.
Required. Indicates a group of library patrons sharing the same service privileges; one of the primary determinants of loan periods, maximum limits, fine rates, etc.
Identifies origin of the patron data
An identifier as locally defined to fulfill reporting requirements
Date on which patron’s privileges became active.
Date on which a patron’s privileges expire. The expiration date in a patron record can be null.
Indicates whether this patron is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

Browse to find the image on your local machine. Click Upload
.

section.title: Contacts Tab
section.para: The Contacts tab contains the patron name and contact information. When you modify contact information to an existing patron record, the old tabs will display above the new. When adding lines to the Address, Phone or Email sub-tabs, enter information and then select the add button.

note.para: Click Details to view and edit the address.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Address on the Contact Tab. Click Details to expand

entry.para: Form of address preceding a name, used in notices and messages addressed to patron
Required. Enter the patron’s first name
Optional. Enter the patron’s middle name
Required. Enter the patron’s last name
A descriptor following a name and providing additional information about a person; used in notices and messages addressed to patron
Required. A descriptor identifying characteristics of an address; an address type must be assigned to any address.
Required. A value that identifies the origin of a patron's address.
The date at which an address becomes the preferred address for sending notices and patron bills.
The date at which an address is no longer the preferred address for sending notices and patron bills.
Indicates whether or not the address is verified; when checking out an item to a patron with an unverified address, the operator will receive a prompt if no addresses have been verified.
Indicates which address is used, if any, to deliver items to the patron, such as when a request is being filled. Only one address can be selected as the Deliver Address.
Indicates which address is used when sending notices and patron bills. Only one address can be the preferred address.
Indicates whether this address is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.
A building name, street number, room number, "attn. of: [nnn]", etc. Three fields are available. Enter the address for the patron.
Enter the name of the city for this address.
Select the state from the State list.
Enter the postal code for this address.
Select the country from the Country list.
A descriptor identifying the type of phone number. Each Phone number must have a type but you cannot use a type more than once.
Enter a phone number for the patron (only numeric characters).
Optional. Enter the phone number’s Extension
Select the country from the Country list.
Indicates which phone number is preferred for contact. Only one phone number can be the preferred number.
Indicates whether this phone number is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.
A descriptor identifying the general use/purpose of the email.
Required. Enter an email address for the patron.
Indicates which email address is preferred for contact. Only one email address can be preferred.
Indicates whether this email is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Affiliation Tab
section.para: The Affiliation tab contains information on how a patron is affiliated and to which campus. When adding lines to the Affiliation tab, enter information and then select the add button.

entry.para: Select the type of affiliation from the Affiliation Type list
Select the campus from the Campus List

section.title: Library Policies Tab
section.para: The Library Policies tab contains information about a patron’s privileges.

entry.para: Flag to indicate if the patron is blocked for a reason not otherwise defined in the system; if flag is on, patron cannot checkout or request items.
A field allowing staff to explain why a general block has been placed on the patron record.

Click the Expand Icon
to expand the note field.
Enables automatic physical delivery of requested items versus being required to pick up requested items from a pick-up location (i.e., a circulation desk).
Allows a patron to place a paging request.
Allows the system to send courtesy notices (expired holds and pending due dates) only to those who request them.

note.para: Courtesy notices can be sent systematically any number of times from the interval setting parameter COURTESY_NOTICE_INTER

section.title: Loaned Records, Requested Records and Temporary Circulation History Tabs
section.para: The Loaned Records, Requested Records, and the Temporary Circulation Historytabs allow you to review items linked to the patron. Each tab includes basic information about a title loaned to the patron as well as the due date. Click the Show ... Items button to see the patron's loaned or requested items, or the patron's temporary Circulation History Record in the current screen. Click the View ... in a New Window to view the items in a separate window or tab that can easily be printed for patrons.

note.para: The Temporary Circulation History Records feature allows users to look up items they have checked out in the past. If privacy concerns trump the desire to offer this feature, a library can opt NOT to create a temporary circulation history.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Loaned Records, Requested Records, Temporary Circulation History Records Tabs

section.title: Proxy Patron and Proxy For Tabs
section.para: The Proxy Patron tab allows you to identify another patron as a proxy for this patron as well as set activation and expiration dates for the proxy. When adding a proxy to the Proxy Patron tab, enter the patron and then select the add button.
The Proxy For tab will display the details of the proxied patron. This tab is not editable.

entry.para:
System Assigned Unique ID. Enter the Patron who will act as the proxy or use the Patron Lookup
.
Display only. Once the patron ID has been entered, this field will auto-populate.
Display only. Once the patron ID has been entered, this field will auto-populate.
Display only. Once the patron ID has been entered, this field will auto-populate.
Date on which the proxy patron becomes active.
Date on which the proxy patron becomes inactive.

section.title: Local Identification Tab
section.para: The Local Identification tab allows you to further distinguish a patron’s connection to the library. When adding a local id to the Local Identification tab, enter the identification and then select the add button.

entry.para: Any identifier as locally defined to further identify the patron, e.g., any other alphanumeric ID used in the institution

section.title: Lost/Invalid Barcode Info Tab
section.para: A patron’s lost/invalid barcode number is tracked to prevent fraudulent use of lost or stolen ID cards. Users may update a patron’s barcode on the Overview tab. When this has been done, any expired barcodes will appear on the Expired/Updated Barcode tab with an Effective date.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Document: Lost/Invalid Barcode Info Tab

section.para: To update a barcode:

listitem.para: Choose Update barcode at the bottom of the Patron record.
In the pop-up window, select a Reason from the dropdown list and add a Description.
Click Confirm to update the Patron record.
On the Patron record, enter a new barcode in the Overview tab.
Select Submit.

section.title: Patron Bills
section.para: From the Patron search screen, staff may view bills and accept payments from the Patron Bill link or create a bill from the Create Bill link.

note.para: For more information about creating patron bills, see Patron Bill Payment

mediaobject.alt: Patron Lookup: Search Results displays links for Patron Bills

listitem.para: Click Patron Bill to view and accept payments for a patron.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Summary: Available by clicking Patron Bill on the Patron Lookup Search Results

listitem.para: Check the bill from the Bills tab or the line item from the Bills in Detail tab that the patron would like to pay.
Select the Payment Mode from the drop down list if you plan to accept a payment.
Enter the Pay Amount.

Click Accept
to receive a payment.

Click Forgive
to forgive an amount.

note.para: This button could also read "Waive" if your institution has implemented the internationalization changes described under Patron Bill. For more information about this change, see the Patron Bill's Implementation Information.

listitem.para:
Click Error
when the charge was made in error.

section.para: When selecting cancel, error, or forgive, you must enter a note in the pop-up box and click ok. This note has a limit of 500 characters.

listitem.para: At a minimum, a patron MUST have the following data elements: last name, first name, borrower type, delivery privileges, paging privileges, affiliation, department, barcode, address, delivery preference, address verified , address (can be either a mail address, email or text; if a mail address), address source (required for each address of any type), courtesy notice preference
Any attempt to create a patron record without a required field will refresh the display with a message indicating the missing data element.
Expiration dates in a patron's record can be set to null.
If courtesy notices are not used by a library, these will be set to "No". If switched to Yes, these will only be produced when a special batch process is run.

section.title: Patron Bill

para.emphasis:
> Patron Bill
> Patron Bill Lookup
> Patron Bill

section.para: Patron bills for overdue fines and replacement fees are generated automatically by the system through check-in and renewal transactions using information from loan transaction records, calculated based on information from the Circulation Policy Set governing the loan, and sent to patrons using their preferred delivery method. Patron bill information is stored in the system; the formatted bill as delivered to the patron is not. Operators can also manually create patron bills.

note.para: Fine rates and replacement fees will be configured locally. By setting fine rates and replacement fees to null or zero, libraries can opt to NOT automatically create these patron bills.

section.para: You may alternatively access Patron Bills via the Patron search screen.

section.title: Search for a Patron Bill
section.para: From the Deliver tab, under the Patron submenu, click Patron Bill to enter the lookup screen.
Enter the Patron's ID or search for the patron by name.

Click the bill number of the bill you wish to view. A popup box will appear with some information about the bill. Click details to view more information including item and transaction information and notes.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Inquiry Pop-up from the Patron Bill Inquiry Screen

section.title: Create a Patron Bill Manually
section.para: Patron bills for replacement and other fees can also be created manually by duly authorized operators using locally-defined fee types, e.g., rentals, copying, etc. and then be delivered to patrons. To do so, click Create Bill on the Patron search screen.

note.para: To pay a patron bill, you must click Patron Bill from the Patron Lookup Screen. For information about paying the bill, see Patron Bill.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Lookup: Click Create Bill at the far right of the search results

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Patron Bill Payment document includes the Patron Section, Patron Bill Section, Fee Type Section and Total Amount tabs in addition to the standard tabs that display at the bottom of OLE documents.

note.para: For more information about the standard tabs, see Standard Tabs under OLE Basic Functionality.

section.title: Patron Section Tab
section.para: The Patron tab is used to identify the patron who has accumulated an overdue fine. It is automatically populated with the name(s) of the individual.

section.title: Patron Bill Section Tab
section.para: The Patron Bill Section

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Document: Patron Bill Section

entry.para: Required. Date/time a payment was recorded
Free text field to enter information regarding the payment transaction

section.title: Fee Type Section Tab
section.para: The Fee Type Section tab contains the fee information pertaining to the bill. When adding lines to Fee Type Section, enter information and then select the add button.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Document: Fee Type Section

entry.para: Required. Choose the fee type from the drop down list. Examples include Overdue, Replacement and Service but these may be locally configured.
Required. Enter the monetary amount for any individual fee.

Enter the item barcode for the loaned item liable for an overdue fine or replacement fee or search for it from the Item lookup
.
Choose the status of the payment from the drop down list.
Optional. Enter a note about the fee.

note.para: There is a 500 character limit on this note field.

entry.para: Click add to add the fee to the patron bill.

section.para: Once the fee has been added, the Details can be expanded to see the title, author, and other pertinent information about the item.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Document: Details expanded on the Fee Type Section

section.title: Total Amount Tab
section.para: If you create multiple fees on a patron’s bill, the system calculates the total amount.

mediaobject.alt: Patron Bill Document: Total Amount Tab

listitem.para: An operator can create a bill manually online by charging any fee.

If an item in a check-in transaction is found to be overdue, the system creates an overdue fine patron bill at check-in, using the applicable values in the appropriate Circulation Policy Set. This bill is then delivered automatically to the patron provided the total amount meets the locally-determined threshold amount. Replacement fee bills are generated by a batch program for those items that are overdue and have received a maximum number of overdue notices.

section.title: Implementation Information
section.para: To remove the word "Forgive" from the Patron Bill and the patron's receipt and replace it with "Waived" or "has been waived". Please note, that these configuration changes allow you to select between these two display values (ie. Forgive or Waived). A different value would not be displayed on the application or be included in the bill printed/emailed to the patron.

listitem.para: Before the war deployment, modify the file /ole-app/olefs/src/main/resources/org/kuali/ole/locale/gb/Labels-Deliver_<Locale>.properties. Add the following lines:
@cmp
{Forgive_Button}
#actionLabel=Waive
@cmp
{forgiveNote}
#label=Waive Note
@cmp
{detailed_Note_View_forgiveNote}
#label=Waive Note

Tomcat setting: Parameter "-Duser.country=XX" needs to set in either one of the files: setenv.bat or setenv.sh. This is required as one of the internationalization settings to let the system know which locale is to be used and which files to pick up for label changes. For the US, the country code is "US" and for the UK, it is "GB", and so on.

note.para: For a full list of country codes, see the Appendix of the Implementation Guide.

listitem.para: System parameter: "DEFAULT_LOCALE_CODE" needs to set as "yy-XX”. This parameter is used by some of the rice files as well.

note.para: System parameters can be modified from within the OLE Interface. For additional information on parameters, see Parameter under Administrative Functions.

listitem.para: System parameter: "PAYMENT_MODE_FORGIVE" needs to be set as "Waived”.
System parameter: "PAYMENT_MODE_FORGIVE_MESSAGE" needs to set as "has been waived".

In the olefs-config-defaults.xml file, you will need to set the value for "ole.locale.properties.folder=gb": This is required to let the system know the location of properties files for label changes.
Change the PAY_FORGIVEN name from "Forgiven" to "Waived" on the Payment Status maintenance document.

note.para: For more information about the maintenance document, see Payment Status.

section.title: Circulation Admin
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Circulation Admin Links
On the Maintenance menu, Circulation Admin provides access to a number of circulation functions that allow users to view and maintain a variety of standard Circulation E-Docs.

section.title: Barcode Status
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Barcode Status
> Barcode Status Lookup
> Barcode Status
The Barcode Status lookup is used to review available statuses for a barcode. Barcode statuses are used in the Patron document to indicate active, lost or stolen patron barcodes.

note.para: Users cannot add or edit the barcode statuses without making changes to the underlying code. This maintenance document is to be removed in 2.0. See OLE-6788.

section.title: Calendar
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Calendar
> Calendar Lookup
> Calendar
A Calendar defines a library’s open and closed days/hours for a definite or indefinite chronological period.

Each Calendar is assigned to a Calendar Group (even if the library uses only one Calendar). A Calendar Group can have one Calendar with no End Date and be used indefinitely OR a Calendar Group can have a chronological sequence of Calendars, one becoming active automatically as soon as the previous one expires.

Each Circulation Desk defines the Calendar Group it uses; if a library has multiple Circulation Desks that share the same hours, all of those Circulation Desks can use the same Calendar Group. Any Circulation Desk with its own hours will need its own Calendar Group.
A Calendar can define individual hours for each day of the week or define the days that share the same hours. Exceptions can be defined by specific dates or by periods of time.

note.para: Day(s) on which a library is always closed are simply not defined when creating a Calendar and therefore do NOT display on any Calendar.

section.para: Each library must have at least one Calendar with a Calendar Group.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Calendar document includes three unique tabs - General, Exception Day, and Exception Period. Above these three tabs, enter the Begin Date, a Group Name, and a Description.

entry.para:
Required. Autopopulates today's date. Enter another date or use the calendar icon
.

If the calendar is part of a chronological sequence within the Calendar Group, an End Date may be required, depending on the position within the sequence. If the Calendar is the only one in the Calendar Group, the End Date is optional.
Required. Select the Calendar Group name to which the Calendar belongs from the drop down menu.

Required. The familiar description, or name, of the calendar. The data entered here appears in a column on the search results when searching for a Calendar. If you will have a sequence of Calendars within a Calendar Group, the Description could be a sequence,, e.g., “Calendar 1”, “Calendar 2”, etc. However, this is free text so you may describe any Calendar as desired.

section.title: General Tab
section.para:
Click Add
.

entry.para: If the library is open 7 days a week and has the same open/close times every day, select Monday for the first day and Sunday for the next day (or whatever span of days your week covers, e.g., Monday and Saturday), enter the open/close times, and then check the “Each Day of the Week” box. If the library has different open/close times for different days, select the same day for the first and second days and then enter the open/close times. Repeat for the other days. NOTE: if you are always closed on a particular day(s) of the week, do NOT enter that day(s). The system does not accept a day entry with blank open/close times.
Enter the open and close time for the library and choose "AM" or "PM" from the drop down list.
Click Add to add the general calendar times.

The date of the calendar exception. Use this to define any day when the library is closed or when a day has open/closed hours that differ from the normal hours as defined in the general tab. Enter the date or use the calendar icon
.
Required if exception date is entered; select from the drop down menu
Blank means closed all day; enter and select "AM" or "PM" to define specific times.
Click Add to add the exception day.

section.title: Exception Period Tab
section.para: If an Exception Period is added, specify days of the week as above. Exception Periods are most likely to be defined when the Calendar has Begin and End Dates. If your Calendar has no End Date, you typically will use Exceptions Days instead of Exception Periods.

entry.para:
The beginning date of the calendar exception period. Enter the date or use the calendar icon
.

The end date of the calendar exception period. Enter the date or use the calendar icon
.
A descriptive title of the exception period.
Click Add to add the exception period.

listitem.para: Operators without create permission will NOT be able to create a new Calendar.
For “Each day of week”, you can either enter each day separately (if open/close times vary by day) or enter a span of days (if open/close times are the same for each day).
Each day of the week check box must be checked for a span of days.
A day’s closed time may be after midnight, e.g., open time=8 AM and close time=1AM.
If a closing time for any day of the week is after midnight, you must enter each day separately with its own open/close times.

If the library is always closed on a day(s) of the week, simply omit that day(s) from your Calendar. The system automatically assumes the library is always closed on that day(s). Do NOT define a regularly-closed day as an Exception Day or Exception Type.

If a library has hours associated with an academic term, interrupted by interim periods with different hours, the library may wish to define a chronological sequence of Calendars within a Calendar Group; in such a scenario, the system expects the Begin Date of the second Calendar in the sequence to be the day after the End Date of the first Calendar in the sequence; and so forth. New Calendars are simply added to the chronological sequence. The final Calendar in the sequence may or may not have an End Date. Alternatively, the library COULD define one Calendar with no End Date, continue to add Exception Days and define its academic interims as Exception Types.
Validation rules have been set up to make it as difficult as possible to define a Calendar or sequence of Calendars with overlapping Begin/End Dates.
It is possible to define an End Date for a Calendar without a chronological successor Calendar.

Exception Days can be added after the fact to record a closed day or a day with abbreviated hours caused by unexpected circumstances or emergencies, e.g., weather, natural disasters, problems with a building’s mechanicals, etc. While this will not automatically adjust certain situations (e.g., this does NOT automatically extend a loan period for items due on that day), it will serve as a reference point for staff asked, e.g., to forgive overdue fines or make other adjustments related to the unanticipated closing.
Open the Calendar Document from the Maintenance tab.

Enter the appropriate data. Click Add
to add a General calendar, exception day or exception period.
Click Submit.

section.title: Maintaining Calendars
section.para: Libraries must establish internal procedures for ensuring that Calendars are created prior to the dates that they need to become effective. There is no automatic alert system in place to notify staff that a Calendar is nearing its End Date.

section.title: Calendar Exception Type
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Calendar Exception Type
> Calendar Exception Type Lookup
> Calendar Exception Type

Before setting up an OLE Calendar (used by each Circulation Desk), you must first define Exception Types. Exception Types define the most common reasons that a library is closed on a day(s) that it would otherwise normally be open. Typical Exception Types might include, but are not limited to:
Holiday
Building Evacuation
Weather Event
Snow Day
Spring Break
As soon as you create a Calendar Exception Type, the name appears in a drop-down menu on a Calendar for use when defining Exception Days and/or Exception Periods.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Exception Type document includes the Add/Edit Calendar Exception Type tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

para.emphasis: Add/Edit Calendar Exception Type Tab Definitions

entry.para: Required. A unique code that identifies the Calendar Exception Type
Required. A descriptive title for the exception type. This displays in a drop-down menu on the Calendar for Exception Day and Exception Period
Indicates whether this Calendar Exception Type is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate.

section.title: Calendar Group
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Calendar Group
> Calendar Group Lookup
> Calendar Group
A Calendar defines a library’s open and closed days/hours for a definite or indefinite chronological period.

Each Calendar is assigned to a Calendar Group (even if the library uses only one Calendar). A Calendar Group can have one Calendar with no End Date and be used indefinitely OR a Calendar Group can have a chronological sequence of Calendars, one becoming active automatically as soon as the previous one expires.

Each Circulation Desk defines the Calendar Group it uses; if a library has multiple Circulation Desks that share the same hours, all of those Circulation Desks can use the same Calendar Group. Any Circulation Desk with its own hours will need its own Calendar Group.
A Calendar can define individual hours for each day of the week or define the days that share the same hours. Exceptions can be defined by specific dates or by periods of time.

note.para: Day(s) on which a library is always closed are simply not defined when creating a Calendar and therefore do NOT display on any Calendar.

section.para: Each library must have at least one Calendar Group.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Calendar Group document includes the Add/Edit Calendar Group tab. The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in this tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

entry.para: Required. A unique code to identify the calendar group.
Required. A descriptive name of the calendar group.
Indicates whether this Calendar Group is active or inactive. Remove the check mark to deactivate

listitem.para: Operators without create permission will NOT be able to create a new Calendar Group.

Each Circulation Desk is associated with a Calendar Group which contains a Calendar(s)—see Calendar. If all Circulation Desks have identical hours, they can all share the same Calendar Group. Any Circulation Desk with its own hours will need to have its own Calendar Group.
Define as many Calendar Groups as you have Circulation Desks with their own hours.
Calendar Groups no longer needed or used should be marked “inactive”.

section.title: Circulation Desk
section.para:
Maintenance
> Circulation Admin
> Circulation Desk
> Circulation Desk Lookup
> Circulation Desk

Circulation desks are the basic work locations where operators circulate items to patrons, check-in items, hold items to give to patrons, and help patrons by creating requests. Circulation Desks can also function as pick-up locations where patrons can claim their requested items.

section.title: Document Layout
section.para: The Circulation Desk document includes the Add/Edit Circulation Desk tab and the Location tab.

section.title: Add/Edit Circulation Desk Tab
section.para: The system automatically enters data into both the Old and New sections in the Add/Edit Circulation Desk tab. Selected data fields are available for editing.

mediaobject.alt: Circulation Desk Document: Add/Edit Circulation Desk

entry.para: Required. The circulation desk code associated with this circulation desk.
Required. The familiar title of the circulation desk’s public view.
Required. The familiar title of the circulation desk’s staff view; may be the same as the public name.
Optional. The number of days an item will remain on hold at this circulation desk.
Optional. The number of days a request will remain open before an expired request notice is sent to the patron. This value may be overridden on the request document when the request is placed.
